intro: Elyna schoenoides, commonly known as the slender marsh grass, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of grass species. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Elyna schoenoides plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various wetland organisms.
